item.title: Kyle Quinn Hid At A Friend's House After Being Misidentified On Twitter As A Racist
item.description: August 17, 2017 - A University of Arkansas professor falsely identified as a participant in a white supremacist rally in Charlottesville says the online reaction was frightening and felt like being chased by a mob.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 17, 2017 - A University of Arkansas professor falsely identified as a participant in a white supremacist rally in Charlottesville says the online reaction was frightening and felt like being chased by a mob. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/17/543980653/kyle-quinn-hid-at-a-friend-s-house-after-being-misidentified-on-twitter-as-a-rac

item.title: Dreamhost Challenges Department Of Justice Anti-Trump Records Request
item.description: August 16, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish speaks with Dallas Kashuba, co-founder of DreamHost. The company challenged the Department of Justice's demand that DreamHost hand over 1.3 million IP addresses for people who visited an anti-trump protest site.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish speaks with Dallas Kashuba, co-founder of DreamHost. The company challenged the Department of Justice's demand that DreamHost hand over 1.3 million IP addresses for people who visited an anti-trump protest site. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/16/543973265/dreamhost-challenges-department-of-justice-anti-trump-records-request

item.title: Quoting Mandela, Obama's Tweet After Charlottesville Is The Most-Liked Ever
item.description: August 16, 2017 - "No one is born hating another person because of the color of his skin or his background or his religion," the former president tweeted. He was quoting Nelson Mandela, and it struck a chord for many.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - "No one is born hating another person because of the color of his skin or his background or his religion," the former president tweeted. He was quoting Nelson Mandela, and it struck a chord for many. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/16/543882516/obama-s-tweet-after-charlottesville-is-the-most-liked-tweet-ever

item.title: UNICEF Picks YouTube Star As Ambassador
item.description: August 16, 2017 - Known as "iiSuperwomanii" to her 12 million YouTube followers, Lilly Singh represents a new kind of celebrity — and that's exactly why UNICEF has made her the face of its cause.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - Known as "iiSuperwomanii" to her 12 million YouTube followers, Lilly Singh represents a new kind of celebrity — and that's exactly why UNICEF has made her the face of its cause. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/16/543389661/unicef-picks-youtube-star-as-ambassador

item.title: Here's What You Need To Know About The Total Solar Eclipse
item.description:
August 16, 2017 - As America prepares for the eclipse on Aug. 21, here are some basic facts about the phenomenon.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/16/541132645/heres-what-you-need-to-know-about-the-total-solar-eclipse
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: DOJ Demands Files On Anti-Trump Activists, And A Web Hosting Company Resists
item.description: August 15, 2017 - Legal experts called the government's demand for information unusually broad. DreamHost says the warrant would require it to hand over logs of 1.3 million visits to its customer's website.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - Legal experts called the government's demand for information unusually broad. DreamHost says the warrant would require it to hand over logs of 1.3 million visits to its customer's website. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/15/543782396/doj-demands-files-on-anti-trump-activists-and-a-web-hosting-company-resists

item.title: Some Are Troubled By Online Shaming Of Charlottesville Rally Participants
item.description: August 15, 2017 - The "Yes, You're Racist" Twitter account uses crowdsourcing to help identify white supremacists. But sometimes it gets things wrong. And not everyone is happy about efforts at public shaming.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - The "Yes, You're Racist" Twitter account uses crowdsourcing to help identify white supremacists. But sometimes it gets things wrong. And not everyone is happy about efforts at public shaming. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/15/543566757/twitter-account-names-and-shames-far-right-activists-at-charlottesville

item.title: British Cybersecurity Expert Pleads Not Guilty To Federal Malware Charges
item.description: August 14, 2017 - Before these allegations, 23-year-old Marcus Hutchins was known for his role in finding the kill switch to the WannaCry ransomware cyber-attack last May. He is accused of creating a malware scheme.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - Before these allegations, 23-year-old Marcus Hutchins was known for his role in finding the kill switch to the WannaCry ransomware cyber-attack last May. He is accused of creating a malware scheme. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/14/543465981/british-cybersecurity-expert-pleads-not-guilty-to-federal-malware-charges

item.title: Forget Tough Passwords: New Guidelines Make It Simple
item.description: August 14, 2017 - We've been told to create passwords that are complicated, to change them regularly and to use different ones for each app or site. But the latest advice is to keep them simple, long and memorable.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - We've been told to create passwords that are complicated, to change them regularly and to use different ones for each app or site. But the latest advice is to keep them simple, long and memorable. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/14/543434808/forget-tough-passwords-new-guidelines-make-it-simple

item.title: Our Homes May Get Smarter, But Have We Thought It Through?
item.description: August 14, 2017 - As our houses fill with the Internet of things, sensors will tell us whether we left the stove on or that we're out of paper towels. But critics worry these devices won't be secure and will spy on us.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - As our houses fill with the Internet of things, sensors will tell us whether we left the stove on or that we're out of paper towels. But critics worry these devices won't be secure and will spy on us. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/14/541699733/our-homes-may-get-smarter-but-have-we-thought-it-through

item.title: Neo-Nazi Site Daily Stormer Is Banned By Google After Attempted Move From GoDaddy
item.description: August 14, 2017 - Both Google and GoDaddy have now banned the Daily Stormer site, after it published a story mocking protester Heather Heyer's death in Charlottesville, Va.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - Both Google and GoDaddy have now banned the Daily Stormer site, after it published a story mocking protester Heather Heyer's death in Charlottesville, Va. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/14/543360434/white-supremacist-site-is-banned-by-go-daddy-after-virginia-rally

item.title: In Germany, Churchgoers Are Encouraged To Tweet From The Pews
item.description: August 14, 2017 - As it celebrates 500 years since Martin Luther and the Reformation, the Protestant church in Germany is turning to social media to reach those too busy to attend.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - As it celebrates 500 years since Martin Luther and the Reformation, the Protestant church in Germany is turning to social media to reach those too busy to attend. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/14/542861104/in-germany-churchgoers-are-encouraged-to-tweet-from-the-pews

item.title: Ashes to Ashes, Dust to ... Interactive Biodegradable Funerary Urns?
item.description: August 13, 2017 - Technology is fundamentally changing how we deal with death, memorials and human remains. One of the latest examples: A startup offers a smartphone-connected urn where ashes are used to grow a tree.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 13, 2017 - Technology is fundamentally changing how we deal with death, memorials and human remains. One of the latest examples: A startup offers a smartphone-connected urn where ashes are used to grow a tree. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/13/542809000/ashes-to-ashes-dust-to-interactive-biodegradable-funerary-urns

item.title: You Can Order a Dozen STD Tests Online — But Should You?
item.description: August 13, 2017 - It sounds so simple: Order a kit online, test for sexually transmitted diseases in the privacy of home and mail it back. But deciding what to test for and who gets tested is far from easy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 13, 2017 - It sounds so simple: Order a kit online, test for sexually transmitted diseases in the privacy of home and mail it back. But deciding what to test for and who gets tested is far from easy. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/13/536905120/you-can-order-a-dozen-std-tests-online-but-should-you

item.title: SoundCloud Saved By The Bell Of A Big Chunk Of Financing
item.description: August 11, 2017 - After a noisy month in the press and a significant round of layoffs, SoundCloud announced today it had secured its largest round of financing to date, ending speculation of its demise (for now).
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 11, 2017 - After a noisy month in the press and a significant round of layoffs, SoundCloud announced today it had secured its largest round of financing to date, ending speculation of its demise (for now). http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/08/11/542817301/soundcloud-saved-by-the-bell-of-a-big-chunk-of-financing
